intro: Pasania fohaiensis, commonly known as the Fohai pasania, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
